arm_group.arm_group_label: human vitreous, human blood serum, PCR
arm_group.description:
human vitreous and blood serum sampling, PCR
1ml of human vitreous and 3ml of human blood serum of patients with various vitreoretinal diseases

biospec_descr.textblock: 3ml of blood serum and 1ml of vitreous

brief_summary.textblock:
MicroRNAs are important regulators of many cellular functions but their expression profile
      in human vitreous is still unclear. Aim of this study is to investigate microRNA expression
      profile by PCR in human vitreous of patients with various vitreoretinal disorders and
      compare with that of patients with macular holes which are suggested to be similar to that
      of healthy subjects.

clinical_study.brief_title: MicroRNA Expression Profile in Human Vitreous of Patients With Various Vitreoretinal Diseases Requiring Vitrectomy
clinical_study.condition: MicroRNA Expression Profile in Human Vitreous of Various Vitreoretinal Diseases

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  any patients undergoing vitrectomy for various vitreoretinal diseases

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previously vitrectomized eyes

study_pop.textblock: Pateints undergoing vitrectomy for various vitreoretinal disesases

primary_outcome.measure: MicroRNA expression profile in human vitreous investigated by PCR

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
